result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Busack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Cost for certified copy of death certificate.
Defendant shall obtain and/or maintain full time employment, full time school or a combination of the two equal to full time status.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with the victims family, including but not limited to Jill M. & John K.

Defendant shall have no contact with persons or places associated with the use or sale of controlled substances outside of a treatment setting. 

Defendant shall not enter any establishments where the primary purpose is the sale/service of alcohol.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath, or urine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend Count 1 to Class D Felony of 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide-940.06(1) and recommend Count 2 would be dismissed for read-in; Court grants amendment. No contest plea entered to Count 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 as amended,  Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
